data.title: Microsoft hints at a new “modern” operating system designed to support different form factors
data.text: In a week where AMD, Intel and Qualcomm have already made major announcements, Microsoft’s keynote yesterday at Computex in Taipei was relatively lowkey. Instead of revealing new products, the company hinted at what it wants in a modernized operating system.

data.title: The Companies Leading On Health For Communities And Families
data.text: To show how business can and must cultivate a Culture of Health, JUST Capital has released new analysis, with support from Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, evaluating how companies perform on core issues of community health.

data.title: Microsoft hasn't given up on its ads business even though Facebook and Google are dominating
data.text: LinkedIn's Drawbridge deal shows a continuing effort to grow Microsoft's relatively small advertising business.
